intro: Galium multiflorum, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or yellowish flowers. The plant is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium multiflorum is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
